name: Mafia Movies: Unraveling the Mob in Italian and North American Cinema
description: (Offered in English) Through a selection of contemporary Italian and American films, such as The Godfather, Gomorra, I cento passi, and others, this course explores the representation of the Mafia, and the myths surrounding it, in relation (and in contrast to) to its historical, political, social, and cultural realities in Italy, Canada, and United States. The course will also analyze the ways in which Italian Mafia films deglamorize the mafioso image while American popular cinema perpetuates its mystique. [24L, 24T]
prerequisites: ITA100Y5. Prerequisite only applicable to students enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major or Specialist program.
